generatedTitle: The Last World Series Victory of the Los Angeles Dodgers

extractFactDictList.question: How many World Series championships do the Los Angeles Dodgers have?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The Los Angeles Dodgers are one of the most successful teams in Major League Baseball (MLB), with six World Series championships to their name.

extractFactDictList.question: When did the Dodgers last win the World Series?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The Dodgers last won the World Series in 1988, defeating the Oakland Athletics in a thrilling seven-game series.

extractFactDictList.sentence: The team was led by legendary manager Tommy Lasorda and featured a roster of talented players, including Hall of Famers Kirk Gibson and Orel Hershiser.

extractFactDictList.sentence: In the 1988 season, the Dodgers finished with a record of 94-67, good enough for second place in the National League West division.

extractFactDictList.question: Who did the Dodgers defeat in the National League Championship Series (NLCS) to advance to the World Series in 1988?
extractFactDictList.sentence: They then went on to defeat the New York Mets in the National League Championship Series (NLCS) to advance to the World Series.

extractFactDictList.sentence: In the World Series, the Dodgers faced off against the Athletics, who had won the American League Championship Series (ALCS) against the Boston Red Sox.

extractFactDictList.sentence: Since then, the Dodgers have made it to the World Series several times but have yet to win another championship.

extractFactDictList.sentence: In conclusion, the last time the Los Angeles Dodgers won the World Series was in 1988. It was a memorable moment for the team and their fans, and one that continues to inspire hope for future championships.
